alert.note: Alert for Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 3:34PM PST until February 25 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM WEDNESDAY TO 4 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches between 1000 to 1500 feet, and 1 to 2 feet between 1500 and 3000 feet. * WHERE...Northeast Foothills/Sacramento Valley and Motherlode Counties. * WHEN...From 10 AM Wednesday to 4 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds and heavy snow could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels 4000-5000 feet Tuesday afternoon, lowering to 1000-2000 Tuesday night through Friday, locally lower. Heaviest snow expected Wednesday afternoon through early Friday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
